title: Alan Forrest
text:
Alan Forrest (born 9 September 1996) is a <a href="Scottish%20people">Scottish</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He currently plays as an <a href="Midfielder">attacking midfielder</a> for <a href="Scottish%20Premiership">Scottish Premiership</a> club <a href="Livingston%20F.C.">Livingston</a>. He began his career at <a href="Ayr%20United">Ayr United</a>, coming through the academy and making 245 appearances for The Honest Men.
He is the younger brother of <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> and <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a> midfielder <a href="James%20Forrest%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201991%29">James Forrest</a>.
Career.
Club.
Forrest made his debut for <a href="Ayr%20United%20F.C.">Ayr United</a> in a <a href="Scottish%20Challenge%20Cup">Scottish Challenge Cup</a> match against <a href="Queen%27s%20Park%20F.C.">Queen's Park</a>. He came off the bench to score an 89th-minute winner at <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park</a>. With this goal Forrest became Ayr's youngest ever goalscorer aged 16 years, 321 days. During the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Scottish%20Championship">2019–20 Scottish Championship</a> season after scoring five goals in three league games Forrest was awarded the <a href="List%20of%20Scottish%20Professional%20Football%20League%20monthly%20award%20winners">Scottish Championship Player of the Month</a> for September.
Forrest signed a pre-contract deal with <a href="Livingston%20F.C.">Livingston</a> on 10 April 2020, making the jump from the <a href="Scottish%20Championship">Scottish Championship</a> to the <a href="Scottish%20Premiership">Scottish Premiership</a>. Forrest made his debut for Livingston on the opening day of the <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Scottish%20Premiership">2020–21 Scottish Premiership</a> season in a 1–0 loss against <a href="St%20Mirren%20F.C.">St Mirren</a> at <a href="St%20Mirren%20Park">St Mirren Park</a>. He scored his first goal for Livingston in a 2–2 draw against <a href="Motherwell%20F.C.">Motherwell</a> on 12 August 2020, at <a href="Fir%20Park">Fir Park</a>.
International.
In 2016, Forrest made his debut for the <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Scotland under-21</a> team in a friendly against <a href="Slovakia%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Slovakia</a>.
Honours.
Club.
Ayr United
